title: Sub Question 1
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

1 point: per location. Both a Latin clause and a translation are required for each location. Minimal Latin underlined. Two possible answers: namque avia cursu dum sequor (for while I seek the pathless places in my haste); et nota excedo regione viarum (and I depart from the familiar district of the roads).
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

1 point: per location. Both a Latin clause and a translation are required for each location. Minimal Latin underlined. Two possible answers: namque avia cursu dum sequor (for while I seek the pathless places in my haste); et nota excedo regione viarum (and I depart from the familiar district of the roads).

Student response earns one of the available points.

Student response earns two of the available points.

title: Sub Question 2
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum
1 point: per explanation. Both a Latin word/phrase and a translation are required for each explanation. Minimal Latin underlined. Four possible answers: substitit (she stopped); erravitne via (she wandered from the path); lassa resedit (she sat down exhausted); misero...fatone erepta (snatched by a sad fate).
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

1 point: per explanation. Both a Latin word/phrase and a translation are required for each explanation. Minimal Latin underlined. Four possible answers: substitit (she stopped); erravitne via (she wandered from the path); lassa resedit (she sat down exhausted); misero...fatone erepta (snatched by a sad fate).

Student response earns one of the available points.

title: Sub Question 3
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

1 point: Aeneas is fated to marry Lavinia. (Lavinia does not have to be identified by name, but the student must refer specifically to relevant events in Books 7-12.)
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

1 point: Aeneas is fated to marry Lavinia. (Lavinia does not have to be identified by name, but the student must refer specifically to relevant events in Books 7-12.)
